text:
World Consumer Day was observed under the auspices of the Pudukottai District Consumer Association at Government Girls’ Higher Secondary School at Alangudi near here on Friday. K. Vezhavendan, general secretary of the Association, spoke on the importance of consumer awareness and explained the consumer protection rules. M. Selvaraj, Assistant Headmaster, spoke on the importance of sensitising the masses to consumer protection rules. Latha Uthathaman, a consumer activist, called upon rural consumers, advised students to verify whether the snacks and biscuit packs purchased by them were well within the expiry date.

‘Inform ARO on

mortgage loans’

Persons obtaining pledge or mortgage loans from private financial institutions and pawn brokers should inform the details of the loan exceeding Rs. 1 lakh, to the Assistant Returning Officer. In a release here on Friday, S. Ganesh, District Collector, said the owners of marriage halls should furnish details of marriages, the names of parents and bride and bridegroom along with the copy of marriage invitation.
title: World Consumer Day observed
